meanings.definition: A measure of the heaviness of an object.
meanings.sent1: The weight of the book was too much for the small child to carry.
meanings.sent2: She checked the weight of the package before sending it.
meanings.sent3: The weight of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The weight of responsibility on his shoulders was immense.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the decision hung heavy in the air.

meanings.definition: The force exerted on an object due to gravity.
meanings.sent1: The weight of the apple caused it to fall from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The weight of the rock pulled it down to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The weight of the balloon made it impossible to float.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the anchor dragged the ship down.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the planet kept the moon in orbit.

meanings.definition: The amount or quantity of heaviness or mass.
meanings.sent1: The weight of the flour in the recipe was crucial.
meanings.sent2: She measured the weight of the ingredients carefully.
meanings.sent3: The weight of the elephant on the seesaw was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the snow on the roof caused it to collapse.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the evidence convinced the jury.
